Job Title: Security Specialist - Industrial Security

Location: Springfield, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!

When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.

Job Description

Parsons is looking for a sharp Security Specialist (Industrial Security) to join our growing team!

In this role you will be a member of a multidiscipline security team for the Client's Industrial Security Team. You will Deliver subject matter expert Industrial Security support to secure the Client's people, facilities, information, and systems while providing guidance and oversight to support an effective protection program. You should be a self-starter with the ability to work autonomously and clearly understand the customer’s expectations and requirements.

What Required Skills You''ll Bring

Must possess an active TS/SCI security clearanceA minimum of 3+ years relevant experienceBachelors or equivalent experience in a related fieldTravel is required, must be able/willing to travel Familiarity with the DD-254 process


What You'll Be Doing

Provide industrial security guidance to contractors using the 32 Code of Federal Regulation (CFR) 117 requirements.Conduct Customer Assistance Visits (CAV) at Industrial facilities and complete detailed trip reports.Prepare and assist with National Interest Determination (NID) packagesPrepare and assist with Facility Security Clearance (FCL) packagesConduct Customer Assistance Meeting (CAM) briefingsConduct Contracting Officer Representative (COR) quarterly briefingRespond to Help Desk tickets and requests for information.Conduct Area Security Officer (ASO) briefingPrepare and complete accurate DD-254 forms and other contract security documents.Reference and use Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC) security directives, instructions, standards, and guidelines to enforce compliance and mitigate security risks.Maintain well organized electronic and hardcopy records.Coordinate with other government agencies in support of the Client.Prepare business and administrative support documents using electronic software tools for efficient and effective program and project management, examples include presentations, written documents, spreadsheets, SharePoint, and other office software tools.Maintain an active access to administration and security electronic software tools, databases and systems as needed to safeguarding classified information, the Client's programs and advance the Industrial and Physical Security Programs of the Client.Draft, review, and maintain internal policy documents, standard operating procedures, and instructional handouts pertaining to Physical and Industrial Security.Prepare various forms of correspondence as required.Ensure assigned security projects and programs comply with required security governance for physical, industrial, information, and other applicable security disciplines, e.g., IC Directives; DOD directives, instructions and manuals; security standards, national interim guidance, and Executive Orders governing physical, industrial and information security.Interpret security policy on matters pertaining to processing, dissemination, and controlling of classified materials.


Minimum Clearance Required To Start

Top Secret SCI

This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.

Our Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our diverse, intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.

Salary Range

$70,500.00 - $145,800.00

We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.

Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.

We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
